detailed_goals: Produce thumbnail sketches for 5 different environment concepts.
Create character silhouettes focusing on unique features and shapes.
Share sketches with the design team for feedback and direction.
Focus on implementing backend functionalities necessary for user interactions.
Integrate UI elements with backend functionalities and ensure seamless transitions.
Conduct playtesting sessions to identify any bugs or usability issues with the new features.
Focus on implementing backend functionalities necessary for user interactions.
Integrate UI elements with backend functionalities and ensure seamless transitions.
Conduct playtesting sessions to identify any bugs or usability issues with the new features.
Identify and define core mechanics that will drive gameplay experience.
Create prototypes for two key mechanics and outline their interactions within the system.
Conduct peer reviews of the prototypes and gather feedback for refinement.
Configure CI tools to automatically run builds whenever changes are pushed to the repository.
Establish automated testing procedures that trigger with each build.
Create documentation outlining the CI process for the development team.
Evaluate and select a bug tracking tool that suits team needs.
Create templates for bug reports to ensure consistent and thorough information is logged.
Train team members on how to report bugs and utilize the bug tracking system effectively.
Model a main character focusing on topology that supports smooth animations.
Create 3D models for two key environment assets that are essential to the gameplay.
Review models together for cohesiveness in style and detail level.
Finalize character and environmental designs based on feedback from Week 1.
Start implementing the core gameplay mechanics in an early prototype.

Focus on implementing backend functionalities necessary for user interactions.
Integrate UI elements with backend functionalities and ensure seamless transitions.

Create low-fidelity wireframes for different screens, focusing on layout and information hierarchy.
Develop interactive prototypes to simulate user interactions and gather feedback from the design and development teams.
Share wireframes and prototypes with stakeholders for initial reviews and incorporate suggestions.
Model a main character focusing on topology that supports smooth animations.
Create 3D models for two key environment assets that are essential to the gameplay.
Review models together for cohesiveness in style and detail level.
Develop player movement controls based on design specifications.
Implement the interaction system for NPC and object interactions.
Coordinate with Client Developers to ensure seamless integration of UI elements.
Identify high-poly models and assess opportunities for LOD creation where applicable.
Implement texture atlasing for 2D assets to minimize draw calls and improve rendering efficiency.
Conduct tests to measure performance impacts of optimized assets in various scenarios, iterating based on results.
Create wireframes and functional specifications for key tools.
Develop a working prototype for one of the core tools.
Gather feedback from initial users to iterate on the prototype's design and functionality.
Construct 3D blockouts of the most promising level layouts.
Test the flow and pacing of the blockouts, identifying areas of improvement.
Share blockouts with the development team for feedback and iterate on designs based on team input.
Develop thematic motifs for different game areas or situations.
Experiment with different musical styles and instruments.
Share early versions of the compositions with the design team for initial feedback.
Develop the authentication system for user accounts.
Set up database schemas and APIs for handling user data.
Conduct unit tests on implemented functionalities to ensure reliability and performance.

Define character motivations, conflicts, and relationships.
